meanings.definition: A descendant or follower of a notable person or group.
meanings.sent1: The epigonous of the famous author continued his legacy by writing similar stories.
meanings.sent2: The epigonous of the king was well-respected for his loyalty and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The epigonous of the superhero tried to save the day but ended up causing more chaos.
meanings.sent4: She felt like an epigonous of her grandmother, following in her footsteps with grace.
meanings.sent5: The epigonous of the legendary warrior trained hard to honor his ancestor's memory.

meanings.sent1: The artist's work was criticized for being too epigonous of famous painters.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was considered epigonous as it lacked fresh ideas or perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The movie felt epigonous, like a mix of scenes from other films put together.
meanings.sent4: His music was described as epigonous, echoing the style of a well-known band.
meanings.sent5: The fashion designer's collection seemed epigonous, lacking a unique touch of its own.
